thread.title: Jets sign Pardy, Halischuk - Winnipeg Free Press
thread.title_full: Jets sign Pardy, Halischuk - Winnipeg Free Press

title: Jets sign Pardy, Halischuk - Winnipeg Free Press
text:
The market is open and the Winnipeg Jets have started today quickly by signing two of their own.
Defenceman Adam Pardy has agreed to a one-year deal with the Jets for a reported $1 million.
CHRIS CARLSON / THE ASSOCIATED PRESS FILES
Jets defenceman Adam Pardy
And Forward Matt Halischuk has re-upped with the NHL for one year on a two-way deal, making $750,000 on the top end.
The Jets signed pending UFA Drew Stafford on Tuesday.
The team has four other unrestricted free agents on the open market today: Michael Frolik, Jim Slater, Lee Stempniak and Jiri Tlusty.
Other free agents today who have been in the organization include Paul Postma, Will O’Neill, John Albert, Julian Melchiori, Patrice Cormier and Eric O’Dell, Keaton Ellerby and Jussi Olkinuora.
Today the window also opens for players who will be free agents on July 1, 2016. The CBA allows contract extensions to most contracts up to one year before the current contract expires.
The Jets, in that mode, are in negotiations with captain Andrew Ladd on an extension. Progress has been made on a contract but there is some work to be done. Expect a six or seven-year deal for Ladd.
Agent Ben Hankinson says he and the Jets have discussed veteran Dustin Byfuglien -- like Ladd, entering the last year of his contract -- but negotiations have not yet begun.
The Jets are also now free to discuss extensions for Jacob Trouba, Mark Scheifele and Adam Lowry, whose entry-level deals will expire next summer.
Agent Pat Morris told the Free Press this morning he doesn’t expect Stempniak to return to Winnipeg.
Rick Curran, agent for Tlusty, said he has spoken with the Jets and the two sides will talk again in the coming days if Tlusty is still on the market and the Jets still have a need for him.
